summary: PayPal, which has been offering crypto transfer services to customers for almost a year, now will allow Venmo users the same courtesy.
title: PayPal brings crypto transfers to 60 million Venmo users
content:
Nearly a year after PayPal allowed users to transfer crypto between its platform and other wallets, the company is set to roll out a similar feature for its more than 60 million Venmo customers located in the United States.

“Customers will also be able to transfer to a PayPal account and to external wallets and exchanges,” the company said in a statement. External wallets include PayPal customers.

In June of last year, PayPal began allowing users to send supported tokens like bitcoin, ether, bitcoin cash and litecoin to external wallets. The move to open the service to tens of millions of Venmo customers starting next month comes at a time when the crypto industry as whole is being confronted with intense scrutiny in the U.S.

While two-thirds of Americans don’t trust crypto, according to a recent survey conducted by the Pew Research Center, it remains popular among millions in the U.S. The same survey said 17% of Americans had invested in or traded cryptocurrency.
Venmo processed $245.3 billion in fiat currency transactions in 2022, according to a recent PayPal earnings statement.
(Updates with the timing of the roll out, which starts in May.)
